SS rolled againg, this time dodging all of the fire,
and aimed his wrist weapon at Perceptor, and sent his
bommerang at his weapon (razor sharp in case you were
wondering).

--- airly2000 <airly2002@...> wrote:
> Perceptor::
> 
> Perceptor aimed again and opened fire against SS.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> wrote:
> > SS rolled over, but still took 1 hit on his upper
> arm.
> > 
> > --- airly2000 <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > Perceptor::
> > > 
> > > Perceptor roared annoyed when he see at Warhead
> > > wounded he considered 
> > > left him there but thought a second it wasn't a
> good
> > > idea, not for 
> > > his plans and for Predacons' glory.
> > > 
> > > He moved quickly where Warhead was while he
> opened
> > > fire against SS.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > 
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > wrote:
> > > > SS crawled over to Burok.
> > > > 
> > > > SS:  I need to get back to the base.....help
> me,
> > > I'm
> > > > too weak to fly.
> > > > 
> > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > The gunfire hitting the ground under which
> the
> > > > > wormbot stood revealed 
> > > > > him. He immediately transformed back to
> robot
> > > mode
> > > > > andhopped out of 
> > > > > his hole. He fired at Inferno's gun as
> precisely
> > > as
> > > > > he could and threw 
> > > > > his tentacules at the antbot's legs, trying
> to
> > > smash
> > > > > him hard to the 
> > > > > ground. His eyes were full of fury as he saw
> > > that
> > > > > already, SS was 
> > > > > down, but Warhead was in an even worse
> > > condition.
> > > > > 
> > > > > The predacon warrior was lying on his back.
> Four
> > > > > holes passing through 
> > > > > him marked where the lasers had burned their
> > > way.
> > > > > His agony was still 
> > > > > lasting, though, and the pain he endured was
> > > > > tremendous. His strength 
> > > > > effectively vanished, making all attempts to
> > > make a
> > > > > sound utterly 
> > > > > useless. He still lived, but his spark would
> not
> > > > > stay for long...
> > > > > 
> > > > >
